AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: The ATLAS transcript mainly shows intake/triage (priority selection and request for details). No customer-facing statements indicate ATLAS gave incorrect guidance, hallucinated, or broke templates, and the customer never says the AI was wrong or unhelpful.
evidence: Customer (Andrew Mugisha): "Ticket 60147163 requested for activation of licenses for Florida Department of Health. Please note this is a first time activation, not a renewal."
ATLAS transcript: "What's the priority of the issue?"

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There is no indication the customer asked for a human and was kept in an AI loop, nor are there repeated AI replies preventing human assistance. The ticket contains multiple human public responses (Shaquille, Alexandr, Raymond).
evidence: Shaquille De Lancy commented publicly: "Dear Andrew, Thank you for contacting the StreetSmart Support Team..."
Alexandr Oliynyk commented publicly: "Dear Andrew, Thank you for your message."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support did not ask the customer to re-provide the same information after it was already supplied. When Andrew corrected the Salesforce opportunity link, the team adapted and continued troubleshooting/escalation rather than repeating the same requests.
evidence: Andrew Mugisha commented publicly: "This is the correct Salesforce opportunity: https://trilogy-sales.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/006Ih000004fwJXIAY/view"
Alexandr Oliynyk commented publicly: "If the issue persists, could you please provide email address of the affected user?"

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The conversation shows regular same-day or next-day responses from support. There are no visible gaps meeting the defined multi-day thresholds, and no customer complaint about waiting days.
evidence: Andrew Mugisha commented publicly [2025-10-09T13:30:55+00:00]: "The customer reports still seeing the following error"
Alexandr Oliynyk commented publicly [2025-10-10T03:21:05+00:00]: "We were unable to reproduce the issue..."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: While multiple messages include an auto-closure warning (“stay open for one week unless...”), there is no explicit closure notice shown, and the ticket continues to be actively worked after those warnings.
evidence: Shaquille De Lancy commented publicly: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."
Raymond Guirguis commented publicly: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: Although the issue was marked “Urgent” in the ATLAS intake, there is no explicit P1/SEV1/outage language in the customer-facing thread (e.g., production down, all users impacted). Support engaged internal onboarding/automation fixes and ultimately deployed a code-side fix, which does not match the defined mishandling pattern.
evidence: Raymond Guirguis commented publicly: "We identified that the issue was related to case sensitivity in the customer's email address during the automation process. This has now been resolved."
